New Records: Greece beat England for the first time in their history.
Greece scored at Wembley for the first time in their history.
Pre-Game Insights: Greece were emotionally dedicated to George Baldock, who had passed away.
Lee Carsley talked about trying a new system, but it didn't come off.
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley said that England were probably second best for a lot of the night.
John Stones said that he thought the best team won, but was disappointed with the result.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Greece's two-goal hero Vangelis Pavlidis talked about the emotional win, dedicating it to George Baldock.
The match was played in a somber mood due to the passing of George Baldock.
